caption:
Follow (us) @IGHT for the best posts and reels 💜 

we do this every year 💀(@ishowspeed) 

Every December, it’s the same ritual—Spotify Wrapped drops, and suddenly, everyone is clutching their pearls over the music they’ve been listening to all year. They act genuinely baffled, as if someone else was in control of their playlists during their late-night emo phases or their hyper-pop workout sessions. “There’s no way I listened to ____ this much,” they’ll say, even though they had it on repeat for three solid months. It’s almost like they expected their Wrapped to unveil some hidden sophistication, but instead, it just confirmed their guilty pleasure for 2000s punk rock and lo-fi beats. The funniest part is when they’re “shocked” that their top song is the one they played 12 times in a row after a breakup. Or when their top genre is “sad indie,” and they act like they didn’t cry to Phoebe Bridgers every other weekend. The memes flood in—“Spotify exposing me again!”—as if they didn’t curate every second of it themselves. In the end, it’s a mix of embarrassment and pride, because while their Wrapped might call them out, it also shows them exactly who they are.
-
